result.name: 2017-scottish-natural-heritage-snh-southern-trench-benthic-camera-survey
result.notes: The primary aim of this benthic survey in the Southern Trench, run by SNH and Marine Scotland Science (MSS) for SNH on the 14th and 15th July 2017 using MSS vessel MRV Alba na Mara (cruise 1117A), was to refine knowledge of MPA protected feature, burrowed mud habitat, distribution. This 1117A survey is part of a series of surveys conducted around the North-east coast of Scotland, at Noss Head, Moray Firth and Southern Trench, to establish the extent of benthic habitats. Quantitative drop-down camera sampling undertaken at 18 stations in the Southern Trench.  Through the analysis of seabed video, the images were used to describe the nature of the seabed in terms of the physical structure and the species assemblages. Runs and run segments were assessed for the presence of protected features and other PMFs, as well as for the presence of species and habitats of recognised conservation importance.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: 2017 Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH) Southern Trench benthic camera survey

extras.value: ["Not to be used for navigation. This survey recorded no species or biotope occurrences that SNH consider as sensitive; all records may therefore be released in response to requests covered by Environmental Information Regulations or Freedom of Information Regulations; additionally its re-use and dissemination is permissible under Open Government Licence terms. Any re-use of this data will acknowledge the copyright owner."]
Colin Moore (originator); Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH), Headquaters (custodian)
